info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 11:58PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Litchfield County through 1245 AM EDT... At 1158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Middlebury, or near Naugatuck, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Thomaston, New Hartford, Norfolk, Litchfield, Canaan, Northwest Harwinton, Oakville, Terryville, New Hartford Center, Woodbury Center, Falls Village, New Preston, Cornwall Bridge, Winsted, Watertown, Plymouth, Woodbury, Harwinton and Barkhamsted. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized ponding of water on roads.
